senses.de: related to clear, understandable reasoning or thinking
senses.ex: Her argument was very logical, and convinced us all.

Tips.title: Clarity Matters
Tips.description: Logical reasoning should lead to clear conclusions, avoid ambiguity or confusion.
Tips.example: His speech was logical; it left no room for misinterpretation.

Tips.title: Emotion vs Reason
Tips.description: Logical is not based on emotions; it's based on reason and evidence.
Tips.example: Despite her frustration, her reply remained calm and logical.

senses.de: following the rules of formal thinking or reasoning
senses.ex: logical principles are the foundation of mathematics and philosophy

Tips.title: Academic Precision
Tips.description: In academics, 'logical' implies precision and adherence to recognized methods.
Tips.example: His thesis was commended for its logical structure and rigorous analysis.

Tips.title: Not Always Intuitive
Tips.description: Logical academic arguments may seem counterintuitive but are formally valid.
Tips.example: The logical theorem challenged common sense, yet it was proven correct.

senses.de: organized and easy to understand because of being arranged in a reasonable order
senses.ex: The report's layout is logical and easy to navigate.

Tips.title: Clear Structure
Tips.description: Logical structures present information in an expected, organized manner.
Tips.example: The guide was logical, starting with basics and advancing to complex topics.

Tips.title: Step-by-Step
Tips.description: Logical progression is about moving from point to point without leaps.
Tips.example: Her logical progression through the steps made the math problem easy to follow.

senses.de: relating to the scientific study of logic
senses.ex: She has a logical perspective on the situation.

Tips.title: Rational Analysis
Tips.description: Logical analytical thinking involves dissecting ideas and reasoning systematically.
Tips.example: He approached the issue with logical analysis, examining all possible outcomes.

Tips.title: Beyond Philosophy
Tips.description: Logical isn't limited to philosophy; it applies to problem-solving in many fields.
Tips.example: Her logical approach saved time during the emergency situation.

senses.de: in computing, relating to a logical operation
senses.ex: Logical operators are used in programming languages.

Tips.title: Computing Exactness
Tips.description: In computing, logical refers to clear, exact operations without ambiguity.
Tips.example: The program functioned correctly, thanks to its logical algorithm.

Tips.title: Digital Clarity
Tips.description: Logical in digital contexts means binary clarity - something is either true or false.
Tips.example: The logical gate outputs '1' only when both inputs are '1'.

Analytical.wordDefinition:
Analytical refers to breaking something down into smaller parts and examining each one carefully to understand how it works.

Both analytical and logical approaches are useful in different contexts. Analytical thinking is useful when trying to understand how something works, while logical thinking is useful when trying to argue a point or make a decision based on evidence.

Coherent.wordDefinition:
Coherent refers to something that is clear, understandable, and consistent. It is applicable when describing writing, speech, or ideas.

For example, a coherent essay is one in which the ideas flow smoothly and are easy to understand.

Coherent describes something that is easy to understand, while logical describes something that makes sense based on reasoning and principles.

Consistent.wordDefinition:
Consistent means that something always happens in the same way, and there are no contradictions or conflicts between different parts of it.

For example, if someone is always on time for meetings, they are consistent in their punctuality.

Both words are applicable in different situations. Consistent is used when talking about things that happen regularly or patterns that are always the same.

To give an example, a restaurant that serves the same quality of food every time is consistent. An argument that says "all cats have fur, my dog has fur, therefore my dog is a cat" is not logical, because it does not follow a clear pattern of reasoning.

Objective.wordDefinition:
Objective refers to something that is unbiased and based on facts rather than personal opinions or feelings.

It is applicable in situations where you need to look at things objectively or without any personal biases. For example, in a scientific experiment, you would need to be objective and not let your personal opinions or feelings affect the results.

To summarize, logical refers to reasoning skills, while objective refers to unbiased facts.

Rational.wordDefinition:
The words logical and rational both refer to ways of thinking and making decisions.

Rational, on the other hand, refers to something that is based on reason or good judgment. If someone makes a rational decision, they have thought about the options and chosen the best one based on available information.

Rational thinking is often used in decision-making and everyday life.

Both logical and rational thinking can be useful in different situations. Logical thinking is often used in fields like math and science, where following a clear set of rules and principles is essential.

Rational thinking is often used in situations where there are multiple options or choices and a decision needs to be made based on careful consideration.

Reasonable.wordDefinition:
Reasonable, on the other hand, means that something is understandable or acceptable based on good judgment or common sense.

For example, if you say, "I cannot buy a new car because I haven't saved enough money yet," that is a reasonable statement because it acknowledges the financial realities of your situation.

So, in short, logical is about following a formal system of reasoning, while reasonable is about making a judgment based on common sense and context.

Sound.wordDefinition:
Sound refers to something that is based on truth, fact or reliable evidence, and is therefore likely to be correct.

So, while something can be logical but not sound, something that is sound is always logical. Logical applies more to the approach to arguments while sound applies more to the arguments themselves.

Valid.wordDefinition:
Valid refers to the soundness of an argument, which means that the conclusion is true based on the premises presented.

In other words, logical means that an argument is well constructed and makes sense, while valid refers to the truthfulness of the conclusion based on the premises presented.

Both words are applicable in critical thinking and the evaluation of arguments. Logical would be used to check if the argument follows a rational pattern, and validity would be used to check if the conclusion is true based on the premises presented.

quotes.Text: We must accept what science tells us, that man was born from the earth. But, more logical than the scientists who lecture us, we must carry this lesson to its conclusion: that is to say, accept that man was born entirely from the world - not only his flesh and bones but his incredible power of thought.
quotes.Title: French Philosopher
quotes.Name: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

quotes.Text: When I first started playing international cricket, people around me started telling me what was being said. And you're never as good as anybody says you are. I try to stay quite logical about things.
quotes.Title: Irish Athlete
quotes.Name: Eoin Morgan

quotes.Text: I feel like you get more bees with honey. But that doesn't mean I don't get frustrated in my life. My way of dealing with frustration is to shut down and to think and speak logically.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Beyonce Knowles

quotes.Text: When you write a novel, you never have to be in the service of the reader. My only concern with my books is that the world that's created be as logical and whole as possible.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Hanya Yanagihara

quotes.Text: The circus allows one to be logical and unreal at the same time. In the circus, all is possible: there can be a man with two heads or a character with a green face.
quotes.Title: Colombian Artist
quotes.Name: Fernando Botero

quotes.Text: If you have a great passion it seems that the logical thing is to see the fruit of it, and the fruit are children.
quotes.Title: Director
quotes.Name: Roman Polanski

quotes.Text: I like solving problems, and science provides a logical way of solving real-life problems.
quotes.Title: American Scientist
quotes.Name: David J. Anderson

quotes.Text: My route so far through life hasn't been particularly logical, or even thought out.
quotes.Title: English Musician
quotes.Name: Jarvis Cocker

quotes.Text: Logically money is important in a boxer's career. That is why one fights.
quotes.Title: Mexican Boxer
quotes.Name: Julio Cesar Chavez Sr.

quotes.Text: The truth of it is that women are far more logical than men.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: George Hamilton
